This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"registerNetwork(address)":{"params":{"_network":"Network address"}},"setLastBorrow(address)":{"params":{"_agent":"Agent address"}},"setLtvBuffer(uint256)":{"params":{"_ltvBuffer":"LTV buffer"}},"slash(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Called only by the lender during liquidation","params":{"_agent":"The agent who is unhealthy","_amount":"The USD value of the delegation needed to cover the debt","_liquidator":"The liquidator who receives the funds"}},"slashTimestamp(address)":{"params":{"_agent":"The agent address"},"returns":{"_slashTimestamp":"Timestamp that is most recent between the last borrow and the epoch -1"}},"slashableCollateral(address)":{"params":{"_agent":"The agent address"},"returns":{"_slashableCollateral":"Amount in USD (8 decimals) that a agent has provided as slashable collateral from the delegators"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. returns.delegation: Amount in USD (8 decimals) that a agent has provided as delegation from the delegators

epoch().details: Returns an epoch which we use to fetch the a timestamp in which we had slashable collateral. Will be less than the epoch on the symbiotic vault.

epochDuration().details: The duration between epochs. Pretty much the amount of time we have to slash the delegated collateral, if delegation is changed on the symbiotic vault.

returns.currentLtv: Loan to value ratio of the agent

returns._0: True if the network is registered

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

slash(address,address,uint256).details: Called only by the lender during liquidation

params._amount: The USD value of the delegation needed to cover the debt
params._liquidator: The liquidator who receives the funds

returns._slashTimestamp: Timestamp that is most recent between the last borrow and the epoch -1

returns._slashableCollateral: Amount in USD (8 decimals) that a agent has provided as slashable collateral from the delegators

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

addAgent(address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: Add agent to be delegated to

coverage(address).notice: How much delegation and agent has available to back their borrows

distributeRewards(address,address).notice: Distribute rewards to networks covering an agent proportionally to their coverage

ltv(address).notice: The LTV of a specific agent

modifyAgent(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Modify an agents config only callable by the operator

setLastBorrow(address).notice: Set the last borrow timestamp for an agent

slash(address,address,uint256).notice: The slash function. Calls the underlying networks to slash the delegated capital

slashTimestamp(address).notice: Get the timestamp that is most recent between the last borrow and the epoch -1

slashableCollateral(address).notice: How much slashable coverage an agent has available to back their borrows
